pullRequest.body:
Change the API for `CartesianClosed` categories: they are now defined as `MonoidalClosed` for the monoidal structure inherited by a `ChosenFiniteProducts` instance. They were previously relying on `HasFiniteProducts`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

I left adaptation notes where I had to make substantial changes to proofs. The biggest addition is `reflectiveChosenFiniteProducts` in `CategoryTheory/Closed/Ideal`.
Extra `ChosenFiniteProducts` instances had to be added in `CategoryTheory/Sites/CartesianClosed`, `Condensed/CartesianClosed` and `Condensed/Light/CartesianClosed`, they rely all on `reflectiveChosenFiniteProducts`.

- [x] depends on: #17613
- [x] depends on: #17733 
- [x] depends on: #18633

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ü§ñ). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
The code looks good to me, but could you update the module docstring of the file `Closed.Cartesian`.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11845214162/job/33010172065)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11845214162/job/33010172291)
The command `adaptation_note` has a limited scope, so that you should use a more basic `-- ...` syntax.
I‚Äôll just remove these notes then. Looks like some of the proofs broke when merging anyways.

In this context, I think we would like that this holds:
```lean
open MonoidalCategory
lemma test [ChosenFiniteProducts C] [Reflective i] (X Y : D) :
  letI := reflectiveChosenFiniteProducts i
  X ‚äó Y = (reflector i).obj (i.obj X ‚äó i.obj Y) := rfl
```
I was not able to unfold the definitions of the tensor product with your definitions, but I think we lose the "chosen" aspect somewhere. I would suggest a definition like this:
```suggestion
  product X Y :=
    { cone := Limits.BinaryFan.mk
        ((reflector i).map (ChosenFiniteProducts.fst (i.obj X) (i.obj Y)) ‚â´
          (reflectorAdjunction i).counit.app _)
        ((reflector i).map (ChosenFiniteProducts.snd (i.obj X) (i.obj Y)) ‚â´
          (reflectorAdjunction i).counit.app _)
      isLimit := sorry }
```

Before we proceed with this refactor PR, I think we should get a better `ChosenFiniteProducts` instance on sheaves. First, if `A` has chosen finite products, then functor categories to `A` also have chosen finite products. Then, as a fullsubcategory of a category of presheaves stable by finite products, the category of sheaves with values in `A` should have an induced chosen finite products structure. As `Sheaf` is an adhoc structure (rather than `FullSubcategory`), we need to define a specific `ChosenFiniteProducts` instance: the only mathematically relevant theorems is that if we have two sheaves, then the the chosen binary product of the underlying presheaves is a sheaf (use `isSheaf_of_isLimit` in `Sites.Limits`)
I would think this construction should go in a separate PR.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: change `CartesianClosed` to rely on `ChosenFiniteProducts`
